back.Definition: An equation that forms a straight line when graphed.
back.Meaning of b: Y-intercept (where the line crosses the y-axis)

front.Used For: Finding roots of a quadratic equation ($ax^2 + bx + c = 0$)

Discriminant ($b^2-4ac$): = 0: Exactly one real root (a repeated root)

back.Statement: In a right triangle, the square of the length of the hypotenuse (the side opposite the right angle) is equal to the sum of the squares of the lengths of the other two sides.
back.Variables: a, b are leg lengths; c is hypotenuse length

back.Definition: The ratio of the vertical change (rise) to the horizontal change (run) between any two distinct points on a line.
Interpretation: Positive slope: line rises from left to right
Negative slope: line falls from left to right

back.Domain: The set of all possible input values (x-values) for which a function is defined.
back.Range: The set of all possible output values (y-values) of a function.
